summary: This document is an investigative report or court filing summarizing the findings of an investigation into the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019. It details failures by prison staff to conduct required checks, falsification of records, and a violation of policy by leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who committed suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the morning of August 10, 2019. He was left without a cellmate contrary to policy.

persons.name: MIMI
persons.context: One of the two prison officers responsible for the SHU area during the night of Epstein's suicide. They failed to conduct required counts and rounds and falsified records.

persons.name: Chief Psychologist
persons.context: Issued a directive, along with the then-Warden, that Epstein should not be left without a cellmate, a policy that was violated.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Issued a directive, along with the Chief Psychologist, that Epstein should not be left without a cellmate, a policy that was violated.

connections.description: MIMI was one of the prison officers responsible for monitoring Epstein in the SHU on the night of his suicide.
Jointly issued a directive regarding Epstein's cellmate status.
The Chief Psychologist was involved in issuing a policy directive concerning Epstein's housing.
The then-Warden was involved in issuing a policy directive concerning Epstein's housing.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day and Night in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was left without a cellmate from the morning of August 9, contrary to MCC policy and a specific directive. Prison officers failed to conduct required checks on him throughout the night.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Body
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's body was discovered at approximately 6:30 a.m. in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Failure to Conduct Prison Counts and Rounds
events.description: The two prison officers responsible for the SHU, including MIMI, failed to conduct required institutional counts at 12 a.m., 3 a.m., and 5 a.m., and most required 30-minute rounds. They falsified records indicating they had done so.

events.title: Last Visual Observation of Epstein
events.description: The last time any prison official observed Jeffrey Epstein was at approximately 9:30 p.m. on August 9.

keyFacts: Two prison officers, including one named MIMI, failed to conduct any of the required inmate counts or most required rounds on the night of Epstein's suicide and falsified records to indicate they had.
No prison official observed Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 9:30 p.m. on August 9 until his body was discovered around 6:30 a.m. on August 10.
Epstein was left without a cellmate from the morning of August 9 until his death, violating MCC policy and a specific directive from the Chief Psychologist and then-Warden.
The investigation involved SDNY, FBI, and DOJ-OIG interviewing over 40 witnesses, reviewing financial records, searching cellphones, and attempting to recover corrupted video footage.
One of the officers (MIMI) had been on duty during Epstein's prior suicide attempt.
